32fcb41d-fc28-4c1f-b270-e2ba9902f4a6.description: The data analytics badge prepares students to understand and work with big and complex data sets across multiple disciplines. The badge enables students to use computational methods for knowledge discovery and data mining, including machine learning techniques as well as parallel and high-performance computing. In addition the badge prepares students evaluate and create visualizations for complex data.
32fcb41d-fc28-4c1f-b270-e2ba9902f4a6.name: Data Analytics

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 635 - Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (3 credits) CIS 671 - Information Visualization Credits (3 credits)  AND one of the following: CIS 677 - High-Performance Computing (3 credits) CIS 678 - Machine Learning Credits (3 credits)

c7497d2b-5158-4dfc-8dfb-c7191033f102.description: Students who complete the badge will gain a skillset that increases their comfort with different cultural groups in both their personal and professional lives. The program guides students to discover and build new knowledge across languages, classes, genders, sexual identities, races, abilities, ethnic backgrounds, religions, and other diverse groups regionally, nationally, and globally.
c7497d2b-5158-4dfc-8dfb-c7191033f102.name: Intercultural Competence

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ITC 100: Introduction to Intercultural Competence (3 credits), LIB 201: Diversity in the United States (3 credits), An elective course (3 credits)

dfc51633-eea4-4f4b-8592-b6146a70210a.description: The School of Computing's cybersecurity badge prepares students to identify, assess and address digital security threats. After completion students will be able to analyze risk using a variety of risk evaluation techniques, discuss legal and ethical issues related to information security and hacking, and use tools to secure networks. Students will learn how to develop frameworks for computer network forensics analysis, and apply tools and techniques for cyber-forensics.
dfc51633-eea4-4f4b-8592-b6146a70210a.name: Cybersecurity

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 615 - Information Security Principles (3 credits) And two of the following: CIS 555 - Applied Cryptography (3 credits) CIS 616 - Data Security and Privacy (3 credits) CIS 617 - Digital Forensics and Investigations (3 credits) CIS 518 - Secure Software Engineering (3 credits) CIS 619 - Data Analytics for Cybersecurity (3 credits)

0c802a25-7b48-47cd-9e31-c26e5cdf779f.description: The School of Computing's software engineering badge is designed to give students deep knowledge of software engineering practice. The badge prepares students to engage with modern software development methodologies, analyze the requirements for a software project, design a test plan for a software project, and apply software security principles to reduce cybersecurity threats.
0c802a25-7b48-47cd-9e31-c26e5cdf779f.name: Software Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 611 - Introduction to Software Engineering, 3 credits; CIS 612 - Requirements Specification, 3 credits; CIS 613 - Software Testing, 3 credits; CIS 518 - Secure Software Engineering, 3 credits

badf067a-5a47-429e-b0d4-27b2860e17a0.description: The Hospitality and Tourism Management badge in food and beverage service provides learners with the knowledge and skills to work responsibly and productively in the food and beverage industry. The badge will prepare learners with selected knowledge and skills.
badf067a-5a47-429e-b0d4-27b2860e17a0.name: Food and Beverage Service

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: HTM 201, Good Food Gone Bad: Food Safety for Everyone (1 credit), HTM 213, Intro to Food & Beverage Management (3 credits), HTM 250, Food Production & Kitchen Management (4 credits)

4ec61d9f-aa56-4fa5-97c8-b4100728fb07.description: The School of Computing's software design and development badge is designed to prepare students to become a modern software developer. The badge enables students to engage with modern software development methodologies, analyze the requirements for a software project, design and create a software solution, create a mobile application, and create a relational database for persistent storage of information.
4ec61d9f-aa56-4fa5-97c8-b4100728fb07.name: Software Design and Development

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 611 - Introduction to Software Engineering, 3 credits; CIS 641 - Systems Analysis and Design, 3 credits; Electives (choose one): CIS 657 - Mobile Application Development, 3 credits; CIS 673 - Principles of Database Design, 3 credits

ca7227dc-f9f7-4424-9dc8-eb23923f39a8.description: The medical and bioinformatics badge prepares students to engage with information systems in a clinical or healthcare setting. The badge enables students to evaluate the requirements for biomedical information systems, engage in project management practices, describe the legal and ethical considerations for biomedical informatics, utilize computational methods for knowledge discovery, create visualizations, design high-performance computing algorithms, and develop machine learning models.
ca7227dc-f9f7-4424-9dc8-eb23923f39a8.name: Biomedical Informatics

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 661 - Introduction to Health and Bioinformatics, CIS 665 - Clinical Information Systems,  AND one of the following:  - CIS 635 - Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining, - CIS 660 - Information Management and Science, - CIS 671 - Information Visualization

6b3105d7-ac34-42f6-99c6-988a68384381.description: This badge signifies competency in the foundational communication skills for American Sign Language. Successful learners will develop expressive and receptive language skills, using fundamental ASL vocabulary and grammatical structures. This badge is not a credential for providing interpreting services to Deaf/Hard of Hearing individuals. GVSU is not authorized to issue interpreting credentials. In Michigan, the Dept. of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs administers interpreting credentials.
6b3105d7-ac34-42f6-99c6-988a68384381.name: Foundational American Sign Language

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ASL 201, ASL 202 * Both classes must be taken at Grand Valley State University. Courses transferred from other institutions do not meet the requirements for this badge.

2b23f996-4435-4dc6-a370-f34782846859.description: The School of Computing's web and mobile computing badge prepares students to design and create web and mobile applications using modern development frameworks. After completing the badge students will also be able to design apps that interact with databases, utilize modern analytics frameworks to collect and analyze usage data, and identify and assess emerging web and mobile technologies.
2b23f996-4435-4dc6-a370-f34782846859.name: Web and Mobile Computing

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 657 - Mobile Application Development (3 credits), CIS 658 - Web Architectures (3 credits)

5ecb55bc-7ba8-4543-a0a4-10ced2a4ddc0.description: This badge in Workplace Technology and Communication gives students much-needed workplace communication skills such as designing effective business documents, recognizing business communication ethical issues, using statistical analysis tools for effective decision making, and creating effective data displays and visualizations. Students earn this badge by successfully completing WRT 350 Business Communication and CIS 231 Problem Solving Using Spreadsheets.
5ecb55bc-7ba8-4543-a0a4-10ced2a4ddc0.name: Workplace Technology and Communication

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: WRT 350: Business Communication (3 credits), CIS 231: Problem Solving Using Spreadsheets (3 credits)

96881ef0-b34d-4a87-a509-1dd3c5704234.description: The School of Computing's database management badge is designed to prepare students to master concepts of relational and non-relational databases. The badge enables students to design and create databases, write programs that interact with databases to manage data, tune the performance of relational database management systems, and utilize emerging non-relational databases such as object-oriented, key-value, and XML databases.
96881ef0-b34d-4a87-a509-1dd3c5704234.name: Database Management

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 673 - Principles of Database Design, 3 credits; AND two of the following: CIS 635 - Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining, 3 credits; CIS 660 - Information Management and Science, 3 credits;  CIS 665 - Clinical Information Systems, 3 credits; CIS 671 - Information Visualization, 3 credits; CIS 676 - Database Management Systems, 3 credits; CIS 679 - Special Topics in Database Management, 3 credits

95f1f7d2-f0ce-4cd3-8e09-ecdb8d53f827.description: The badge covers computational methods for knowledge discovery in bioinformatics and medicine. Topics covered are dynamic programming (sequence alignment, BLAST search engine),Hidden Markov Models (phylogenetic trees, structure prediction),clustering and discriminations models for micro-array analysis(Gene Expression Data), selected data mining software, and working with biological databases.
95f1f7d2-f0ce-4cd3-8e09-ecdb8d53f827.name: Data Mining Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 635 - Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

e3e2d7d0-e7dc-41a4-b542-e697db154a0f.description: The School of Computing's distributed computing badge is designed to prepare students to solve the difficult issues related to having computers cooperate in solving a problem. The badge enables students to write programs that utilize TCP/IP to transmit information; understand the fundamentals of network security; evaluate and solve issues posed by distributed systems such as clock synchronization, universal naming, and data consistency; design and create web applications.
e3e2d7d0-e7dc-41a4-b542-e697db154a0f.name: Distributed Computing

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 654 - Computer Networking, 3 credits; CIS 656 - Distributed Systems, 3 credits; CIS 658 - Web Architectures, 3 credits

skills.name: Analyze Existing Physical Networking And Security Components And Processes And Operations

cca55e29-e0ce-4e6f-8a15-9b54f8f82203.description: The badge covers concepts of information visualization, principles in vision and perception, algorithms for building information spaces, and principles of user interface design. Case studies demonstrate information visualization used to solve specific retrieval and decision problems for biological data. Evolution of visual user interfaces and visualization tools, visual information retrieval, and knowledge representation.
cca55e29-e0ce-4e6f-8a15-9b54f8f82203.name: Information Visualization Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 671 - Information Visualization

68f66713-d78a-42e3-8e90-7a88efa4f35c.description: The Palliative and Hospice Care Model (Palliative and Hospice Care I) Badge recognizes completion of a 3-credit graduate level course covering the history and philosophy of Palliative and Hospice Care. In addition, current clinical skills related to holistic assessment, communication, and ethical considerations in end-of-life care are presented and practiced.
68f66713-d78a-42e3-8e90-7a88efa4f35c.name: Palliative and Hospice Care I

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: Nur 581 Chronic and Terminal illness: The Palliative/Hospice Model (3 credits)

skills.name: Legal And Ethical Issues In Healthcare

54179ad6-50dd-4943-af0f-66a5446188e4.description: The Symptom Management in Palliative and Hospice Care (Palliative and Hospice Care II) Badge recognizes completion of a graduate level course covering the assessment and management of pain and other symptoms encountered in palliative and hospice care practice. Skills for incorporation of holistic considerations into management decisions are emphasized. Pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic approaches to symptom management are considered.
54179ad6-50dd-4943-af0f-66a5446188e4.name: Palliative and Hospice Care II

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: Nur 582 Complex Pain and Symptom Management (3 credits)

3c62ed4d-2e4a-434f-bec2-5762c7de4787.description: This badge signifies advanced communication skills in conversational ASL and an understanding of Deaf culture. Successful learners will be able to use ASL in extended communication and will be able to explain key features of Deaf culture. This badge is not a credential for providing interpreting services to Deaf/Hard of Hearing individuals. GVSU is not authorized to issue interpreting credentials. In Michigan, the Dept. of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs administers interpreting credentials.
3c62ed4d-2e4a-434f-bec2-5762c7de4787.name: Advanced American Sign Language

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ASL 203, ASL 421 * Both classes must be taken at Grand Valley State University. Courses transferred from other institutions do not meet the requirements for this badge. ** Prerequisites for ASL 203 may be satisfied through transfer credit from another approved accredited institution.

4500cab6-6120-42f9-b1c8-68832d1bdc3e.description: This badge is designed to prepare experienced tax practitioners for advanced level tax research and planning for a variety of issues, including employee benefit plans, executive compensation, changes in accounting methods and periods, inter-company transactions, IRS audits, and more. The graduate tax badge in Advanced Tax Practice includes three courses that develop advanced tax specialists to take on some of the most difficult tax questions in practice.
4500cab6-6120-42f9-b1c8-68832d1bdc3e.name: Advanced Tax Practice

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ACC 631: Employee Benefit Plans and Deferred Compensation; ACC 632: Tax Accounting; ACC 639: Federal Tax Practice and Procedure

2bde3379-b25f-4725-86e3-76c84a850ca2.description: The badge in cannabis operations is designed to prepare students who work or aspire to work in the retail cannabis industry or ancillary fields. From a holistic perspective, students develop an understanding of the importance of cannabis retail management to the cannabis industry and local communities, and learn appropriate practices to purchase, store, and distribute various types of cannabis products. Both positive and negative practices associated with cannabis use and legislation are taught.
2bde3379-b25f-4725-86e3-76c84a850ca2.name: Cannabis Operations

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: HTM 217 (3 credits), HTM 242 (3 credits, and HTM 317 (3 credits) are required.

17197f83-363c-419f-ae78-d9ffd9a4a16d.description: This badge will recognize students who pursue coursework, co-curricular activities, and experiential learning opportunities centered in civic learning and democratic engagement. It aims to inspire students to align democratic ideals and civic commitment with deep knowledge of context, history, and policy. It aims to teach students through formal curricula, project learning, and co-curricular activities the values and practices required to sustain democracy.
17197f83-363c-419f-ae78-d9ffd9a4a16d.name: Civic Change Agent Badge

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: A total of 12 credit hours and a co-curricular learning project is required for this badge: 12 hours of coursework from an approved list of courses at different levels from different disciplines and a project with a co-curricular and/or experiential focus.

3eafec27-4f21-40ac-9a80-54de1697345e.description: This badge is designed to prepare experienced tax practitioners for advanced level tax research and planning for corporate transactions, including corporate liquidations, mergers and consolidations, multi-state tax issues, and international tax issues. The graduate tax badge in Corporate Transactions consists of three courses that provide deep knowledge in corporate taxation.
3eafec27-4f21-40ac-9a80-54de1697345e.name: Corporate Transactions

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ACC 625: Corporate Tax II; ACC 630: Multistate Taxation; ACC 633: International Tax Practice

8366956e-d050-477b-ae2b-e113f95a9fc7.description: Students who complete the database fundamentals badge will be able to design, create, and interact with relational databases in order to manage complex data. Students will understand the principles of database tables, data types, and the “relations”/linkages between tables.
8366956e-d050-477b-ae2b-e113f95a9fc7.name: Database Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 512

4f8caedb-b8aa-4901-8b1f-79fc5f3d10db.description: The badge is an introduction to the application of digital forensics principles and practices to collect, examine, analyze and preserve digital evidence in support of cyber forensics investigations in various computing systems. This course is a blended mix of lecture and hands-on exercises to reinforce the concepts discussed in the lecture.
4f8caedb-b8aa-4901-8b1f-79fc5f3d10db.name: Digital Forensics Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 617 - Digital Forensics and Investigations

1a19d433-fc96-4ff6-805e-a0633de946c9.description: The graduate electromagnetic compatibility badge (EMC) certifies knowledge of the EMC principles necessary to design or redesign electronic products that can be successfully tested for EMC compliance.
1a19d433-fc96-4ff6-805e-a0633de946c9.name: Electromagnetic Compatibility Graduate Badge

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: EGR 543 & EGR 643

4700a7ad-ee42-46fe-a37c-9bd3def4f75c.description: The undergraduate electromagnetic compatibility badge (EMC) certifies knowledge of electromagnetic fundamentals and EMC principles to design and test electronic products for EMC compliance.
4700a7ad-ee42-46fe-a37c-9bd3def4f75c.name: Electromagnetic Compatibility Undergraduate Badge

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: EGR 343 & EGR 443

59a4dd1b-30cb-4efa-b026-937117dd6093.description: The School of Engineering's embedded systems badge prepares students in the areas of embedded HW/SW that would be valued in their workplace setting. The badge enables students to understand the microcontroller architecture, develop software using structured programming language, integrate hardware and software to develop microcontroller-based applications to control an electromechanical system and write necessary firmware for implementing a rudimentary RTOS using various programming languages.
59a4dd1b-30cb-4efa-b026-937117dd6093.name: Embedded Systems

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: EGR 524 – Design of Microcontroller Applications (4 credits) EGR 536 – Embedded Systems Interface (4 credits)

e4021b95-1202-466d-99ce-33a0ac99c939.description: This badge is designed to prepare students and practicing accountants for entry-level tax research, planning, and preparation for corporations, partnerships, estates, gifts, and trusts. The graduate tax badge in Foundations of Tax Practice consists of four courses that develop tax specialists who have a breadth of foundational knowledge across various areas of tax.
e4021b95-1202-466d-99ce-33a0ac99c939.name: Foundations of Tax Practice

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ACC 622: Tax Research and Writing; ACC 624: Corporate Tax 1; ACC 627: Estate, Gift, & Trust I; ACC 629: Partnership Taxation

9409fad1-4694-48ee-be14-fd02eb174c2c.description: The badge presents the principles of information security, and how to integrate these principles into the systems life cycle. Coverage includes a broad overview of information security concepts, requirements, threats, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures, with an emphasis on designing for security, risk management, and security policies.
9409fad1-4694-48ee-be14-fd02eb174c2c.name: Information Security Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 615 - Information Security Principles

04302977-4275-49f5-bd8e-338d11d8cd8b.description: The information systems management badge prepares students to engage with information systems and software project management in a business setting. The badge enables students to analyze the business needs that drive the need for IS solutions, evaluate and choose appropriate system development lifecycles and methodologies, and use tools for planning and running an information systems project.
04302977-4275-49f5-bd8e-338d11d8cd8b.name: Information Systems Management

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 641 - Systems Analysis and Design (3 credits) CIS 642 - IS Project Management (3 credits) CIS 643 - Information Systems Policy and Strategy (3 credits)

638a5135-dd26-4576-a756-5cd951f9aea0.description: The badge covers planning, organizing, staffing, controlling, and directing information systems projects. Major emphasis on project planning, techniques and tools for monitoring and controlling projects, and teamwork and leadership issues. A term project that involves the development of a project plan for a nontrivial information system project using project management tools is required.
638a5135-dd26-4576-a756-5cd951f9aea0.name: Information Systems Project Management Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 642 - IS Project Management

304db348-895d-4261-ae5e-bed0a7b56285.description: The badge covers fundamental concepts and technologies underlying mobile application development. Important aspects of developing and deploying conventional mobile applications are covered, such as mobile user interfaces, location-based services, integration with social media and other web-based services. Effective use of mobile analytics and privacy concerns will also be covered.
304db348-895d-4261-ae5e-bed0a7b56285.name: Mobile Application Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 657 - Mobile Application Development

d57d113f-f363-46b2-9c88-17dfc9d92a56.description: The networking fundamentals badge covers the basic principles of wireless and wired networks. Students earning the badge will understand how the internet protocols (TCP/IP) permit communication between computers.
d57d113f-f363-46b2-9c88-17dfc9d92a56.name: Networking Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 511

b9d6175b-ef42-47bc-b5a0-769b4f9caef2.description: The badge provides students with a basic understanding of advanced programming concepts, common data structures and collections, concurrency, software modeling, searching and sorting algorithms. Elements of discrete mathematics are integrated through lectures and programming projects.
b9d6175b-ef42-47bc-b5a0-769b4f9caef2.name: Object-Oriented Programming Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 500 - Fundamentals of Software Practice

b59f7a66-5b57-4413-90eb-8f38970a4534.description: The public history badge gives students the opportunity to see history at work in the world. Students who complete the badge will take part in collaborative, place-based, community projects, meet public history professionals, and explore range of career paths available at museums, archives, parks, historical societies, and more.
b59f7a66-5b57-4413-90eb-8f38970a4534.name: Public History Badge

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: Public History (HST 420), Museum Studies (HST/CLA 415), Local and Community History (HST 405)

186099c0-fc66-4078-98c6-a1dc746eb903.description: This badge will prepare participants to implement and optimize telehealth use in health and health care settings, including reimbursement and facilitating clinical visits while adhering to legal and privacy issues.
186099c0-fc66-4078-98c6-a1dc746eb903.name: Telehealth

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: NUR 706 - Telehealth (3 credits)

8582148d-1bc7-4fb6-abbc-cacdd06d538b.description: This badge is designed to prepare experienced tax practitioners for advanced level tax research and planning for estates, gifts, and trusts, including transfer tax issues, distributable net income, simple trusts, fiduciary accounting income, throwback rules, special valuation rules, and more. The graduate tax badge in Wealth Planning consists of two courses that provide deep knowledge in fiduciary income tax and estates, gifts, and trusts.
8582148d-1bc7-4fb6-abbc-cacdd06d538b.name: Wealth Planning

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: ACC 628: Fiduciary Income Tax; ACC 641: Advanced Estate, Gift & Trust

6df419c9-28d1-4d8b-97a9-2284368d8846.description: The badge covers current and emerging web-based technologies, protocols, system architectures, development frameworks, and languages.
6df419c9-28d1-4d8b-97a9-2284368d8846.name: Web Application Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by GVSU Academic Badges and authorized by Grand Valley State University

badge_template_activities.title: CIS 658 - Web Architecture
